intro: Cupaniopsis brachythyrsa, commonly known as the narrow-caledonia hakea, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its floral structure consists of showy, pinkish-white blooms that appear in spring, attracting various pollinators. Cupaniopsis brachythyrsa is often used in coastal gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
